snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown should sign a sensible bill that recognizes that locking ex-offenders out of the job market is a bad idea.
abstract: Editorial calls on California Gov Jerry Brown to sign bill passed by Legislature that would bar government agencies from asking job applicants about criminal convictions until the agency has determined that the applicant meets minimum qualifications for the job; holds that bill sensibly realizes that locking ex-offenders out of the job market is a bad idea.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown should sign a sensible bill that recognizes that locking ex-offenders out of the job market is a bad idea.
